DOC.HEAD: Father of Accuser Says His Son is a Liar and Thief
DOC.TEXT: The father of a former male prostitute who accused the Rev. Bruce Ritter of misusing Covenant House money and engaging in a sexual affair called his son an emotionally troubled liar and a thief. ``And he has a pattern of intentionally hurting people who try to help him, particularly people who've become a father figure to him,'' Alton Kite said of his son, 25, who used the name Timothy Warner when he made the allegations against the founder of Covenant House, an acclaimed shelter for runaways. Kite said at a news conference Wednesday that his son's behavior is caused by a diagnosed personality disorder and that he has received psychiatric treatment. Kevin Lee Kite's charges of financial improprieties by the Roman Catholic priest are being investigated by the district attorney's office. Colleen Roche, a spokeswoman for the Manhattan district attorney's office, had no comment on the elder Kite's remarks. The younger Kite, using another alias, was taken in by Covenant House in New Orleans early last year. He was moved to New York after he said he feared associates involved in drug running and prostitution would kill him. Earlier this month, Kevin Kite charged that he and Ritter began a sexual affair shortly after he was given haven here. The former prostitute said that in return for sex, Ritter put him in an apartment, enrolled him in a college, bought him clothes, a TV set and a computer and gave him spending money. Ritter and other Covenant House officials denied the sexual allegations and any financial wrongdoing. Kite's father, a junior-college accounting teacher in a town near Dallas, said he decided to speak out after Covenant House officials told him about his son's charges against Ritter. ``Kevin has caused people great problems and hardship with his dishonesty before,'' Alton Kite said. ``I would like to help someone who has suffered because of him.'' He said he has spent thousands of dollars and suffered immeasurable heartache trying to compensate his son's victims, which include friends and neighbors. ``We're still paying for it,'' Kite said. ``His mother and I are both teachers. We have almost no resources left, financially or emotionally.'' Kite said he had not spoken to his son since January. James Harnett, executive director of Covenant House, said that the younger Kite ``lied to us about his name, lied to us about his age, about his hometown and about his life being in danger. We also know he's a thief _ his father has confirmed that.'' Covenant House, founded by Ritter in New York, manages 17 shelters with more than 2,000 beds in the United States, Toronto and Latin America.
